<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000"><span style="text-decoration: none;">Good Wednesday morning. </span></strong><span style="text-decoration: none;">We missed the grand opening last weekend, but are you familiar with Tyler Perry’s studio in Atlanta? At 330 acres, the complex is bigger than Warner Bros., Paramount, and Disney’s Burbank studios...combined.   </span><strong style="color:#000"></strong><span style="text-decoration: none;"></span></p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li dir="ltr" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px;list-style-type: disc; text-decoration: none;">
<span>
</span><span><span style="text-decoration: none;">“Think about the poetic justice in that,” Perry told </span></span><span><a href="https://www.cbsnews.com/news/tyler-perry-studios-on-the-poetic-justice-of-building-new-studio-on-former-confederate-army-base/" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">CBS This Morning</a></span><span><span style="text-decoration: none;">. “</span></span><span><span style="text-decoration: none;">The Confederate Army is fighting to keep Negroes enslaved in America, fighting, strategy, planning on this very ground. And now this very ground is owned by me.”</span></span><span><span style="text-decoration: none;"></span></span><span>
</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><span style="text-decoration: none;">Goosebump city. Have a great day and, for those observing Yom Kippur, an easy fast. </span></p>
<div><span style="text-decoration: none;"> </span></div>

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
INVESTING
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/10/08/blackrock-bullish-circular-economy?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
For BlackRock, Time Is a Flat, Green Circle
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="For BlackRock, Time Is a Flat, Green Circle" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=447 src="https://morningbrew-oslo.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/1570570724.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="For BlackRock, Time Is a Flat, Green Circle" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://morningbrew-oslo.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/1570570724.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">BlackRock, the largest asset manager in the world, <a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-blackrock-climate-change-fund/blackrock-bets-on-the-circular-economy-with-new-fund-idUSKBN1WN1MC?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">announced</a> a $20 million fund in collaboration with the Ellen MacArthur Foundation to invest in dozens of companies with hardcore sustainability missions. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Early recipients include Adidas (-1.12%), which is making sneakers out of recycled plastic waste from the ocean; Tomra, which builds <a href="https://www.tomra.com/sv-se/collection/reverse-vending/reverse-vending-news/2017/how-does-a-reverse-vending-machine-work?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">reverse vending machines</a> (you put the bottles <em>in</em> and get deposits or refunds <em>out</em>); and Ball Corp (-1.44%), which is manufacturing recyclable cups so you can play apple juice pong with a clear conscience.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">BlackRock (-2.37%) is hyped on the “circular economy.” It ideally works as follows:</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Use equipment and infrastructure for longer; reduce harmful outputs like emissions and waste; reuse materials instead of funneling in new resources. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">A good example: </strong></span><span>Yesterday, Lego </span><span><a href="https://apnews.com/dbbe0b57b1ac4114a9c7c7862d101e8f?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">announced</a></span><span> a send-in program for unwanted Legos to be distributed through Teach for America.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Got something to prove? </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">BlackRock is the largest renewables investor...but also the largest fossil fuel investor. With $6.84 trillion in assets under management, it’s just a massive investor period.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Alongside fellow index fund powerhouse Vanguard, BlackRock's regularly <a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-usa-funds-index-climatechange/biggest-u-s-index-funds-oppose-most-climate-proposals-in-shareholder-votes-idUSKBN1WN105?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">voted against and criticized</a> climate-related shareholder resolutions. Last year, the two supported just 10% and 12% of those resolutions, respectively. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Index funds say they prefer pushing climate-related agendas in private meetings with execs.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">By 2020, Deutsche Bank <a href="https://www.ft.com/content/15fc8468-e9b3-11e9-a240-3b065ef5fc55?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">expects</a> half of assets managed by investment companies to have environmental, social, or corporate governance considerations. Index funds control half the stock mutual fund market, which = tons of influence. But so far, they've largely taken a backseat to their portfolio companies' management.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>Consumers and governments have been pushing businesses to de-sprawl their sprawling environmental footprints for years. Now, investors are adding top-down pressure across their portfolios to push the needle even more.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In practice, though, the lack of public disclosures, <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2019/09/12/reuters-america-investing-green-is-all-the-rage-but-benchmarks-still-hazy.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">standardized metrics</a>, and enforceable goals makes it difficult to see whether that needle is actually moving.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
CHINA
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/10/08/blizzard-entertainment-boots-esports-pro-hong-kong-comments?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Whatever You Do...Don't Make China Mad
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="No Alt" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC83MjMyL2ltZ18yODE2X2pwZ193XzEwMjRfYW1wX21heGhlaWdodF80MDk2X2FtcF9tb2RlX3BhZF9hbXBfZm9ybWF0X2pwZy5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Blizzard Entertainment</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">For the second time in a week, a figure in the sports world has caused drama on a global scale by expressing support for Hong Kong's pro-democracy protests.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, Blizzard Entertainment <a href="https://kotaku.com/blizzard-suspends-hearthstone-player-for-hong-kong-supp-1838864961?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">booted</a> professional esports player Chung "Blitzchung" Ng Wai from its Grandmasters tournament after he said, "Liberate Hong Kong! Revolution of our age!" in a post-game interview. It's also withholding prize money and banning Blitzchung from playing its game, Hearthstone, professionally for a year. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Last Friday, Houston Rockets GM Daryl Morey </span><span><a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/10/07/houston-rockets-draw-ire-gms-china-stance?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">upended</a></span><span> the NBA-China relationship with a pro-protest tweet. Things </span><span><a href="https://www.theguardian.com/sport/2019/oct/08/adam-silver-nba-china-tv-broadcasts-hong-kong?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">escalated</a></span><span> further yesterday.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture:</strong> It's "increasingly difficult for multinationals to navigate commerce in the Communist country," <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2019/10/08/world/asia/china-nba-tweet.html?action=click&module=Top%20Stories&pgtype=Homepage&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">writes the NYT</a>. U.S. companies including Delta, Marriott, and Gap have <a href="https://www.axios.com/china-nba-corporate-america-hong-kong-protests-cf9af430-4f8f-4968-aca3-c4b90fb5b2d1.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">recently adjusted</a> their (mis)representations of China's territories to meet the Chinese government's wishes.  </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Who's not sorry? </strong><em>South Park </em>creators Trey Parker and Matt Stone. After their latest episode was <a href="https://apnews.com/1a05fe5fee124a769f32dca046dc08ad?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">erased</a> from the Chinese internet, they commented satirically, "Like the NBA, we welcome the Chinese censors into our homes and into our hearts. We too love money more than freedom and democracy."</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">+ For a contrarian take, </strong>read Tyler Cowen's <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/opinion/articles/2019-10-07/daryl-morey-hong-kong-tweet-houston-rockets-and-nba-got-it-right?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">column</a> for Bloomberg Opinion. </p>

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SPACE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/10/08/boeing-buys-minority-stake-virgin-galactic?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Boeing's no Longer a Space Virgin
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Boeing's no Longer a Space Virgin" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTcwNTY2MDcxLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Virgin Galactic</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Boeing <a href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/business/2019/10/08/boeing-invest-million-richard-bransons-virgin-galactic/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">plans to invest</a> $20 million for a minority stake in Richard Branson's space tourism company, Virgin Galactic. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">We know, in the world of space travel $20 million is what you pay for an oversized suitcase. But the small investment will kick off a longer-term partnership between Boeing and Branson that might lead to a commercially viable <em>hypersonic </em>jet.<strong style="color:#000"></strong></p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Hypersonic is a bigger deal than supersonic. </strong></span><span>Hypersonic means traveling at 5x the speed of sound...or faster.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Virgin Galactic claims that a hypersonic jet could take you from Los Angeles to Tokyo (5,400+ mi.) in two hours. Today, that trip takes ~11 hours. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>Both companies are <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-10-08/boeing-bets-20-million-on-virgin-galactic-as-space-trips-beckon?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">planning</a> to launch commercial space flights next year. Boeing will send astronauts to the International Space Station...Virgin Galactic will send really rich people to a place where Elizabeth Warren can't reach them. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>Virgin Galactic wants to go public this year on the NYSE via a merger with investment firm Social Capital Hedosophia. If all goes according to plan, Virgin will be the first public company for human spaceflight, <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2019/10/08/boeing-20-million-stake-in-virgin-galactic-with-vision-of-hypersonic.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">per CNBC</a>. </p>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ECONOMY
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/10/08/world-economic-leaders-give-mixed-reviews-economy?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
World Economic Leaders: At Least They're Honest
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="World Economic Leaders: At Least They're Honest" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTcwNTY3MzE5LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>NICHOLAS KAMM/AFP via Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Newly-minted leaders of the International Monetary Fund (IMF) and World Bank (World Bank) channeled their new-job moxie into some <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/imf-and-world-banks-new-leaders-warn-of-deteriorating-global-outlook-11570543201?mod=hp_lista_pos3&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">gloomy economic diagnoses</a> yesterday. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">What they said:</strong> </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Kristalina Georgieva, who took over at the IMF at the start of October, </span><span><a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-10-08/new-imf-chief-sees-serious-risk-global-slowdown-will-spread?srnd=premium&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">said the fund</a></span><span> now expects global economic growth to fall to its lowest rate since the beginning of the decade. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>David Malpass became president of the World Bank in April, and in June his organization predicted the global economy would grow 2.6% in 2019, the slowest rate in three years. Yesterday, Malpass said he planned to downgrade the downgrade. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The causes: </strong>Play the hits. Brexit, the U.S.-China trade war, and a wounded Europe. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The cures: </strong>Georgieva said central banks shouldn't go too crazy slashing interest rates...but governments could kick up their spending. Malpass encouraged developed countries to gear their tax and spending policies toward growth. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">And don't forget Jerome Powell. </strong>At a conference in Denver, <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2019/10/08/powell-says-the-fed-will-start-expanding-its-balance-sheet-soon.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">the Fed chair</a> 1) said he'd add to the Fed's roster of government-backed securities to soothe overnight lending markets and 2) left the door open for yet another interest rate cut.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
MUSIC
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/10/08/eagles-announce-supersized-tour?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Soaring Eagles Spotted in California
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>

<img alt="Soaring Eagles Spotted in California" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTcwNTY5MzEzLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Ethan Miller/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, the rock band Eagles <a href="https://www.usatoday.com/story/entertainment/music/2019/10/08/eagles-hotel-california-performance-2020-tour/3906862002/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">announced the details</a> of their 2020 tour of North America. A summary: Take it anything but easy. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The Eagles will perform their 1976 album <em>Hotel California</em> with the help of a 22-voice choir and a 46-piece orchestra. 77 musicians in total will be onstage. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>The tour kicks off in Atlanta on Feb. 7 and concludes in Los Angeles (</span><span><a href="https://www.allmusic.com/artist/eagles-mn0000144847/biography?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">where it all began</a></span><span>) in April. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The backstory: </strong>Consider this a victory lap. In 2018, the Eagles’s first compilation album, <em>Their Greatest Hits 1971<span>–</span>1975</em>, <a href="https://www.npr.org/2018/08/20/640327499/the-eagles-have-the-best-selling-album-of-all-time-for-now?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">topped <em>Thriller</em></a> as the bestselling album of all time.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">ATTN: dads. </strong>Tickets go live on Ticketmaster Friday.</p>

!mso]\u003e--\u003e\u003c!-- --\u003e\n\u003cimg class=\"story-header-image\" alt=\"For BlackRock, Time Is a Flat, Green Circle\" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eFrancis Scialabba\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBlackRock, the largest asset manager in the world, \u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/us-blackrock-climate-change-fund/blackrock-bets-on-the-circular-economy-with-new-fund-idUSKBN1WN1MC?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eannounced\u003c/a\u003e a $20 million fund in collaboration with the Ellen MacArthur Foundation to invest in dozens of companies with hardcore sustainability missions. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eEarly recipients include Adidas (-1.12%), which is making sneakers out of recycled plastic waste from the ocean; Tomra, which builds \u003ca href=\"https://www.tomra.com/sv-se/collection/reverse-vending/reverse-vending-news/2017/how-does-a-reverse-vending-machine-work?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ereverse vending machines\u003c/a\u003e (you put the bottles \u003cem\u003ein\u003c/em\u003e and get deposits or refunds \u003cem\u003eout\u003c/em\u003e); and Ball Corp (-1.44%), which is manufacturing recyclable cups so you can play apple juice pong with a clear conscience.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBlackRock (-2.37%) is hyped on the “circular economy.” It ideally works as follows:\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eUse equipment and infrastructure for longer; reduce harmful outputs like emissions and waste; reuse materials instead of funneling in new resources. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eA good example: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eYesterday, Lego \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/dbbe0b57b1ac4114a9c7c7862d101e8f?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eannounced\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e a send-in program for unwanted Legos to be distributed through Teach for America.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eGot something to prove? \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBlackRock is the largest renewables investor...but also the largest fossil fuel investor. With $6.84 trillion in assets under management, it’s just a massive investor period.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAlongside fellow index fund powerhouse Vanguard, BlackRock's regularly \u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/us-usa-funds-index-climatechange/biggest-u-s-index-funds-oppose-most-climate-proposals-in-shareholder-votes-idUSKBN1WN105?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003evoted against and criticized\u003c/a\u003e climate-related shareholder resolutions. Last year, the two supported just 10% and 12% of those resolutions, respectively. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eIndex funds say they prefer pushing climate-related agendas in private meetings with execs.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBy 2020, Deutsche Bank \u003ca href=\"https://www.ft.com/content/15fc8468-e9b3-11e9-a240-3b065ef5fc55?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eexpects\u003c/a\u003e half of assets managed by investment companies to have environmental, social, or corporate governance considerations. Index funds control half the stock mutual fund market, which = tons of influence. But so far, they've largely taken a backseat to their portfolio companies' management.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eConsumers and governments have been pushing businesses to de-sprawl their sprawling environmental footprints for years. Now, investors are adding top-down pressure across their portfolios to push the needle even more.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIn practice, though, the lack of public disclosures, \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2019/09/12/reuters-america-investing-green-is-all-the-rage-but-benchmarks-still-hazy.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003estandardized metrics\u003c/a\u003e, and enforceable goals makes it difficult to see whether that needle is actually moving.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" Revolution of our age!\" in a post-game interview. It's also withholding prize money and banning Blitzchung from playing its game, Hearthstone, professionally for a year. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eLast Friday, Houston Rockets GM Daryl Morey \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/10/07/houston-rockets-draw-ire-gms-china-stance?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eupended\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e the NBA-China relationship with a pro-protest tweet. Things \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.theguardian.com/sport/2019/oct/08/adam-silver-nba-china-tv-broadcasts-hong-kong?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eescalated\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e further yesterday.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBig picture:\u003c/strong\u003e It's \"increasingly difficult for multinationals to navigate commerce in the Communist country,\" \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2019/10/08/world/asia/china-nba-tweet.html?action=click\u0026module=Top%20Stories\u0026pgtype=Homepage\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewrites the NYT\u003c/a\u003e. U.S. companies including Delta, Marriott, and Gap have \u003ca href=\"https://www.axios.com/china-nba-corporate-america-hong-kong-protests-cf9af430-4f8f-4968-aca3-c4b90fb5b2d1.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003erecently adjusted\u003c/a\u003e their (mis)representations of China's territories to meet the Chinese government's wishes.  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWho's not sorry? \u003c/strong\u003e\u003cem\u003eSouth Park \u003c/em\u003ecreators Trey Parker and Matt Stone. After their latest episode was \u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/1a05fe5fee124a769f32dca046dc08ad?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eerased\u003c/a\u003e from the Chinese internet, they commented satirically, \"Like the NBA, we welcome the Chinese censors into our homes and into our hearts. We too love money more than freedom and democracy.\"\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e+ For a contrarian collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBoeing \u003ca href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/business/2019/10/08/boeing-invest-million-richard-bransons-virgin-galactic/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eplans to invest\u003c/a\u003e $20 million for a minority stake in Richard Branson's space tourism company, Virgin Galactic. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWe know, in the world of space travel $20 million is what you pay for an oversized suitcase. But the small investment will kick off a longer-term partnership between Boeing and Branson that might lead to a commercially viable \u003cem\u003ehypersonic \u003c/em\u003ejet.\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eHypersonic is a bigger deal than supersonic. \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eHypersonic means traveling at 5x the speed of sound...or faster.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eVirgin Galactic claims that a hypersonic jet could take you from Los Angeles to Tokyo (5,400+ mi.) in two hours. Today, that trip takes ~11 hours. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eBoth companies are \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-10-08/boeing-bets-20-million-on-virgin-galactic-as-space-trips-beckon?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eplanning\u003c/a\u003e to launch commercial space flights next year. Boeing will send astronauts to the International Space Station...Virgin Galactic will send really rich people to a place where Elizabeth Warren can't reach them. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003eVirgin Galactic wants to go public this year on the NYSE via a merger with investment firm Social Capital Hedosophia. style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhat they said:\u003c/strong\u003e \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul of the World Bank in April, and in June his organization predicted the global economy would grow 2.6% in 2019, the slowest rate in three years. Yesterday, Malpass said he planned to downgrade the downgrade. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe causes: \u003c/strong\u003ePlay the hits. Brexit, the U.S.-China trade war, and a wounded Europe. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe cures: \u003c/strong\u003eGeorgieva said central banks shouldn't go too crazy slashing interest rates...but governments could kick up their spending. Malpass encouraged developed countries to gear their tax and spending policies toward growth. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong In 2018, the Eagles’s first compilation album, \u003cem\u003eTheir Greatest Hits 1971\u003cspan\u003e–\u003c/span\u003e1975\u003c/em\u003e, \u003ca href=\"https://www.npr.org/2018/08/20/640327499/the-eagles-have-the-best-selling-album-of-all-time-for-now?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etopped \u003cem\u003eThriller\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/a\u003e as the bestselling album of all time.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp
